intro: Ditaxis sinaloae, commonly known as the Sinaloa ditaxis, is a flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert region of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
